module.name: su
module.summary: Run shells with substitute user and group

template.name: su_restricted_domain_template
template.summary: Restricted su domain template.

desc.p: This template creates a derived domain which is allowed to change the linux user id, to run shells as a different user.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

param.name: user_domain
param.summary: The type of the user domain.

param.name: user_role
param.summary: The role associated with the user domain.

template.name: su_per_role_template
template.summary: The per role template for the su module.

desc.p: This template creates a derived domain which is allowed to change the linux user id, to run shells as a different user.
This template is invoked automatically for each user, and generally does not need to be invoked directly by policy writers.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

param.name: user_domain
param.summary: The type of the user domain.

param.name: user_role
param.summary: The role associated with the user domain.

interface.name: su_exec
interface.summary: Execute su in the caller domain.

module.name: sudo
module.summary: Execute a command with a substitute user

template.name: sudo_per_role_template
template.summary: The per role template for the sudo module.

desc.p: This template creates a derived domain which is allowed to change the linux user id, to run commands as a different user.
This template is invoked automatically for each user, and generally does not need to be invoked directly by policy writers.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

param.name: user_domain
param.summary: The type of the user domain.

param.name: user_role
param.summary: The role associated with the user domain.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The type of the process performing this action.

desc.p: Tripwire file integrity checker.

NOTE: Tripwire creates temp file in its current working directory. This policy does not allow write access to home directories, so users will need to either cd to a directory where they have write permission, or set the TEMPDIRECTORY variable in the tripwire config file. The latter is preferable, as then the file_type_auto_trans rules will kick in and label the files as private to tripwire.

module.name: corecommands
module.summary: Core policy for shells, and generic programs in /bin, /sbin, /usr/bin, and /usr/sbin.
module.required: Contains the base bin and sbin directory types which need to be searched for the kernel to run init.

interface.name: corecmd_executable_file
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable for files that are exectuables, such as binary programs. This does not include shared libraries.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used for files.

interface.name: corecmd_bin_alias
interface.summary: Create a aliased type to generic bin files.

desc.p: Create a aliased type to generic bin files.
This is added to support targeted policy. Its use should be limited. It has no effect on the strict policy.

interface.name: corecmd_bin_entry_type
interface.summary: Make general progams in bin an entrypoint for the specified domain.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The domain for which bin_t is an entrypoint.

interface.name: corecmd_sbin_entry_type
interface.summary: Make general progams in sbin an entrypoint for the specified domain.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The domain for which sbin programs are an entrypoint.

interface.name: corecmd_shell_entry_type
interface.summary: Make the shell an entrypoint for the specified domain.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The domain for which the shell is an entrypoint.

interface.name: corecmd_search_bin
interface.summary: Search the contents of bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_list_bin
interface.summary: List the contents of bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_getattr_bin_files
interface.summary: Get the attributes of files in bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_read_bin_files
interface.summary: Read files in bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_read_bin_symlinks
interface.summary: Read symbolic links in bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_read_bin_pipes
interface.summary: Read pipes in bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_read_bin_sockets
interface.summary: Read named sockets in bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_exec_bin
interface.summary: Execute generic programs in bin directories, in the caller domain.

interface.name: corecmd_manage_bin_files
interface.summary: Create, read, write, and delete bin files.

interface.name: corecmd_relabel_bin_files
interface.summary: Relabel to and from the bin type.

interface.name: corecmd_mmap_bin_files
interface.summary: Mmap a bin file as executable.

interface.name: corecmd_bin_spec_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute a file in a bin directory in the specified domain but do not do it automatically. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

desc.p: Execute a file in a bin directory in the specified domain. This allows the specified domain to execute any file on these filesystems in the specified domain. This is not suggested.
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.
This interface was added to handle the userhelper policy.

param.name: target_domain
param.summary: The type of the new process.

interface.name: corecmd_bin_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute a file in a bin directory in the specified domain.

desc.p: Execute a file in a bin directory in the specified domain. This allows the specified domain to execute any file on these filesystems in the specified domain. This is not suggested.
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.
This interface was added to handle the ssh-agent policy.

param.name: target_domain
param.summary: The type of the new process.

module.name: devices
module.summary: Device nodes and interfaces for many basic system devices.

desc.p: This module creates the device node concept and provides the policy for many of the device files. Notable exceptions are the mass storage and terminal devices that are covered by other modules.
This module creates the concept of a device node. That is a char or block device file, usually in /dev. All types that are used to label device nodes should use the dev_node macro.

Additionally, this module controls access to three things:
the device directories containing device nodes
device nodes as a group
individual access to specific device nodes covered by this module.

module.required: Depended on by other required modules.

interface.name: dev_node
interface.summary: Make the passed in type a type appropriate for use on device nodes (usually files in /dev).

param.name: object_type
param.summary: The object type that will be used on device nodes.

interface.summary: Allow full relabeling (to and from) of all device nodes.

param.summary: Domain allowed to list device nodes.

interface.summary: Set the attributes of /dev directories.

interface.summary: Get the attributes of the memory type range registers (MTRR) device.

interface.name: dev_read_mtrr
interface.summary: Read the memory type range registers (MTRR). (Deprecated)

desc.p: Read the memory type range registers (MTRR). This interface has been deprecated, dev_rw_mtrr() should be used instead.
The MTRR device ioctls can be used for reading and writing; thus, read access to the device cannot be separated from write access.

interface.name: dev_write_mtrr
interface.summary: Write the memory type range registers (MTRR). (Deprecated)

desc.p: Write the memory type range registers (MTRR). This interface has been deprecated, dev_rw_mtrr() should be used instead.
The MTRR device ioctls can be used for reading and writing; thus, write access to the device cannot be separated from read access.

interface.name: dev_rw_mtrr

module.name: domain
module.required: Contains the concept of a domain.

interface.name: domain_base_type
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable as a basic domain.

desc.p: Make the specified type usable as a basic domain.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used as a basic domain type.

interface.name: domain_type
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable as a domain.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used as a domain type.

interface.name: domain_entry_file
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable as an entry point for the domain.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type of program used for entering the domain.

interface.name: domain_interactive_fd
interface.summary: Make the file descriptors of the specified domain for interactive use (widely inheritable)

interface.name: domain_dyntrans_type
interface.summary: Allow the specified domain to perform dynamic transitions.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to perform dynamic transitions.
This violates process tranquility, and it is strongly suggested that this not be used.

interface.name: domain_system_change_exemption
interface.summary: Makes caller and execption to the constraint preventing changing to the system user identity and system role.

interface.name: domain_subj_id_change_exemption
interface.summary: Makes caller an exception to the constraint preventing changing of user identity.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type to make an exception to the constraint.

interface.name: domain_role_change_exemption
interface.summary: Makes caller an exception to the constraint preventing changing of role.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type to make an exception to the constraint.

interface.name: domain_obj_id_change_exemption
interface.summary: Makes caller an exception to the constraint preventing changing the user identity in object contexts.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type to make an exception to the constraint.

interface.name: domain_user_exemption_target
interface.summary: Make the specified domain the target of the user domain exception of the SELinux role and identity change constraints.

desc.p: Make the specified domain the target of the user domain exception of the SELinux role and identity change constraints.
This interface is needed to decouple the user domains from the base module. It should not be used other than on user domains.

interface.name: domain_cron_exemption_source
interface.summary: Make the specified domain the source of the cron domain exception of the SELinux role and identity change constraints.

desc.p: Make the specified domain the source of the cron domain exception of the SELinux role and identity change constraints.
This interface is needed to decouple the cron domains from the base module. It should not be used other than on cron domains.

interface.name: domain_cron_exemption_target
interface.summary: Make the specified domain the target of the cron domain exception of the SELinux role and identity change constraints.

desc.p: Make the specified domain the target of the cron domain exception of the SELinux role and identity change constraints.
This interface is needed to decouple the cron domains from the base module. It should not be used other than on user cron jobs.

interface.name: domain_use_interactive_fds
interface.summary: Inherit and use file descriptors from domains with interactive programs.

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_use_interactive_fds
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to inherit file descriptors from domains with interactive programs.

interface.name: domain_sigchld_interactive_fds
interface.summary: Send a SIGCHLD signal to domains whose file discriptors are widely inheritable.

interface.name: domain_setpriority_all_domains
interface.summary: Set the nice level of all domains.

interface.name: domain_signal_all_domains
interface.summary: Send general signals to all domains.

interface.name: domain_signull_all_domains
interface.summary: Send a null signal to all domains.

interface.name: domain_sigstop_all_domains
interface.summary: Send a stop signal to all domains.

interface.name: domain_sigchld_all_domains
interface.summary: Send a child terminated signal to all domains.

interface.name: domain_kill_all_domains
interface.summary: Send a kill signal to all domains.

interface.name: domain_search_all_domains_state
interface.summary: Search the process state directory (/proc/pid) of all domains.

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_search_all_domains_state
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to search the process state directory (/proc/pid) of all domains.

interface.name: domain_read_all_domains_state
interface.summary: Read the process state (/proc/pid) of all domains.

interface.name: domain_getattr_all_domains
interface.summary: Get the attributes of all domains of all domains.

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_getattr_all_domains
interface.summary: Get the attributes of all domains of all domains.

interface.name: domain_read_confined_domains_state
interface.summary: Read the process state (/proc/pid) of all confined domains.

interface.name: domain_getattr_confined_domains
interface.summary: Get the attributes of all confined domains.

interface.name: domain_ptrace_all_domains
interface.summary: Ptrace all domains.

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_ptrace_all_domains
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to ptrace all domains.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to ptrace all domains.
Generally this needs to be suppressed because procps tries to access /proc/pid/environ and this now triggers a ptrace check in recent kernels (2.4 and 2.6).

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_ptrace_confined_domains
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to ptrace confined domains.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to ptrace confined domains.
Generally this needs to be suppressed because procps tries to access /proc/pid/environ and this now triggers a ptrace check in recent kernels (2.4 and 2.6).

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_read_all_domains_state
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to read the process state (/proc/pid) of all domains.

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_list_all_domains_state
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to read the process state directories of all domains.

interface.name: domain_getsession_all_domains
interface.summary: Get the session ID of all domains.

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_getsession_all_domains
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the session ID of all domains.

interface.name: domain_getattr_all_sockets
interface.summary: Get the attributes of all domains sockets, for all socket types.

desc.p: Get the attributes of all domains sockets, for all socket types.
This is commonly used for domains that can use lsof on all domains.

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_getattr_all_sockets
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of all domains sockets, for all socket types.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of all domains sockets, for all socket types.
This interface was added for PCMCIA cardmgr and is probably excessive.

interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of all domains TCP sockets.

interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get attribues of all domains packet sockets.

interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get attribues of all domains raw sockets.

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_rw_all_key_sockets
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to read or write all domains key sockets.

interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of all domains unix datagram sockets.

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_getattr_all_stream_sockets
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of all domains unix datagram sockets.

interface.summary: Execute the entry point files for all domains in the caller domain.

module.name: files

desc.p:
This module contains basic filesystem types and interfaces. This includes:
The concept of different file types including basic files, mount points, tmp files, etc.
Access to groups of files and all files.
Types and interfaces for the basic filesystem layout (/, /etc, /tmp, /usr, etc.).

module.required: Contains the concept of a file. Comains the file initial SID.

interface.summary: Make the specified type usable for files in a filesystem.

param.summary: Type to be used for files.

desc.p: Register an interpreter for new binary file types, using the kernel binfmt_misc support.
A common use for this is to register a JVM as an interpreter for Java byte code. Registered binaries can be directly executed on a command line without specifying the interpreter.

interface.name: fs_cifs_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute a file on a CIFS or SMB filesystem in the specified domain.

desc.p: Execute a file on a CIFS or SMB filesystem in the specified domain. This allows the specified domain to execute any file on these filesystems in the specified domain. This is not suggested.
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.
This interface was added to handle home directories on CIFS/SMB filesystems, in particular used by the ssh-agent policy.

param.name: target_domain
param.summary: The type of the new process.

interface.name: fs_nfs_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute a file on a NFS filesystem in the specified domain.

desc.p: Execute a file on a NFS filesystem in the specified domain. This allows the specified domain to execute any file on a NFS filesystem in the specified domain. This is not suggested.
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.
This interface was added to handle home directories on NFS filesystems, in particular used by the ssh-agent policy.

param.name: target_domain
param.summary: The type of the new process.

interface.name: kernel_sendrecv_unlabeled_association
interface.summary: Send and receive messages from an unlabeled IPSEC association.

desc.p: Send and receive messages from an unlabeled IPSEC association. Network connections that are not protected by IPSEC have use an unlabeled assocation.
The corenetwork interface corenet_non_ipsec_sendrecv() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_dontaudit_sendrecv_unlabeled_association
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to send and receive messages from an unlabeled IPSEC association.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to send and receive messages from an unlabeled IPSEC association. Network connections that are not protected by IPSEC have use an unlabeled assocation.
The corenetwork interface corenet_dontaudit_non_ipsec_sendrecv() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_tcp_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Receive TCP packets from a NetLabel connection.

desc.p: Receive TCP packets from a NetLabel connection, NetLabel is an explicit packet labeling framework which implements CIPSO and similar protocols.
The corenetwork interface corenet_tcp_recv_netlabel() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_dontaudit_tcp_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to receive TCP packets from a NetLabel connection.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to receive TCP packets from a NetLabel connection. NetLabel is an explicit packet labeling framework which implements CIPSO and similar protocols.
The corenetwork interface corenet_dontaudit_tcp_recv_netlabel() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_udp_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Receive UDP packets from a NetLabel connection.

desc.p: Receive UDP packets from a NetLabel connection, NetLabel is an explicit packet labeling framework which implements CIPSO and similar protocols.
The corenetwork interface corenet_udp_recv_netlabel() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_dontaudit_udp_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to receive UDP packets from a NetLabel connection.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to receive UDP packets from a NetLabel connection. NetLabel is an explicit packet labeling framework which implements CIPSO and similar protocols.
The corenetwork interface corenet_dontaudit_udp_recv_netlabel() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_sendrecv_unlabeled_packets
interface.summary: Send and receive unlabeled packets.

desc.p: Send and receive unlabeled packets. These packets do not match any netfilter SECMARK rules.
The corenetwork interface corenet_sendrecv_unlabeled_packets() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_unconfined
interface.summary: Unconfined access to kernel module resources.

module.name: mcs
module.required: Contains attributes used in MCS policy.

interface.name: mcs_killall
interface.summary: This domain is allowed to sigkill and sigstop all domains regardless of their MCS category set.

interface.name: mcs_ptrace_all
interface.summary: This domain is allowed to ptrace all domains regardless of their MCS category set.

interface.name: mcs_process_set_categories
interface.summary: Make specified domain MCS trusted for setting any category set for the processes it executes.

module.name: mls

desc.p: This module contains interfaces for handling multilevel security. The interfaces allow the specified subjects and objects to be allowed certain privileges in the MLS rules.

module.required: Contains attributes used in MLS policy.

interface.name: mls_file_read_up
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from files at higher levels.

interface.name: mls_file_write_down
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to files at lower levels.

interface.name: mls_file_upgrade
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for raising the level of files.

interface.name: mls_file_downgrade
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for lowering the level of files.

interface.name: mls_socket_read_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from sockets at any level.

interface.name: mls_socket_read_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from sockets at any level that is dominated by the process clearance.

interface.name: mls_socket_write_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to sockets at any level.

interface.name: mls_net_receive_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for receiving network data from network interfaces or hosts at any level.

interface.name: mls_sysvipc_read_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from System V IPC objects at any level.

interface.name: mls_sysvipc_write_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to System V IPC objects at any level.

interface.name: mls_rangetrans_source
interface.summary: Allow the specified domain to do a MLS range transition that changes the current level.

interface.name: mls_rangetrans_target
interface.summary: Make specified domain a target domain for MLS range transitions that change the current level.

interface.name: mls_process_read_up
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from processes at higher levels.

interface.name: mls_process_write_down
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to processes at lower levels.

interface.name: mls_process_set_level
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for setting the level of processes it executes.

interface.name: mls_xwin_read_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from X objects at any level.

interface.name: mls_xwin_write_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to X objects at any level.

interface.name: mls_colormap_read_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from X colormaps at any level.

interface.name: mls_colormap_write_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to X colormaps at any level.

interface.name: mls_trusted_object
interface.summary: Make specified object MLS trusted.

desc.p: Make specified object MLS trusted. This allows all levels to read and write the object.
This currently only applies to filesystem objects, for example, files and directories.

interface.name: mls_fd_use_all_levels
interface.summary: Make the specified domain trusted to inherit and use file descriptors from all levels.

interface.name: mls_fd_share_all_levels
interface.summary: Make the file descriptors from the specifed domain inheritable by all levels.

module.name: selinux
module.summary: Policy for kernel security interface, in particular, selinuxfs.
module.required: Contains the policy for the kernel SELinux security interface.

interface.name: selinux_get_fs_mount
interface.summary: Gets the caller the mountpoint of the selinuxfs filesystem.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type requesting the selinuxfs mountpoint.

interface.name: selinux_dontaudit_getattr_dir
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of the selinuxfs directory.

interface.name: selinux_search_fs
interface.summary: Search selinuxfs.

interface.name: selinux_dontaudit_search_fs
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to search selinuxfs.

interface.name: selinux_dontaudit_read_fs
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to read generic selinuxfs entries

interface.name: selinux_get_enforce_mode
interface.summary: Allows the caller to get the mode of policy enforcement (enforcing or permissive mode).

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type to allow to get the enforcing mode.

interface.name: selinux_set_enforce_mode
interface.summary: Allow caller to set the mode of policy enforcement (enforcing or permissive mode).

desc.p: Allow caller to set the mode of policy enforcement (enforcing or permissive mode).
Since this is a security event, this action is always audited.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type to allow to set the enforcement mode.

interface.name: selinux_load_policy
interface.summary: Allow caller to load the policy into the kernel.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type that will load the policy.

interface.name: selinux_set_boolean
interface.summary: Allow caller to set the state of Booleans to enable or disable conditional portions of the policy.

desc.p: Allow caller to set the state of Booleans to enable or disable conditional portions of the policy.
Since this is a security event, this action is always audited.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type allowed to set the Boolean.

interface.name: selinux_set_parameters
interface.summary: Allow caller to set SELinux access vector cache parameters.

desc.p: Allow caller to set SELinux access vector cache parameters. The allows the domain to set performance related parameters of the AVC, such as cache threshold.
Since this is a security event, this action is always audited.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type to allow to set security parameters.

interface.name: selinux_validate_context
interface.summary: Allows caller to validate security contexts.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type permitted to validate contexts.

interface.name: selinux_compute_access_vector
interface.summary: Allows caller to compute an access vector.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type allowed to compute an access vector.

interface.name: selinux_compute_create_context
interface.summary: Calculate the default type for object creation.

interface.name: selinux_compute_member
interface.summary: Allows caller to compute polyinstatntiated directory members.

interface.name: selinux_compute_relabel_context
interface.summary: Calculate the context for relabeling objects.

desc.p: Calculate the context for relabeling objects. This is determined by using the type_change rules in the policy, and is generally used for determining the context for relabeling a terminal when a user logs in.

interface.name: selinux_compute_user_contexts
interface.summary: Allows caller to compute possible contexts for a user.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type allowed to compute user contexts.

interface.name: selinux_unconfined
interface.summary: Unconfined access to the SELinux kernel security server.

module.name: storage

This template is invoked automatically for each user, and generally does not need to be invoked directly by policy writers.

template.name: userdom_common_user_template
template.summary: The template containing rules common to unprivileged users and administrative users.

desc.p: This template creates a user domain, types, and rules for the user's tty, pty, tmp, and tmpfs files.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_unpriv_user_template
template.summary: The template for creating a unprivileged user.

desc.p: This template creates a user domain, types, and rules for the user's tty, pty, home directories, tmp, and tmpfs files.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: userdom_admin_user_template
template.summary: The template for creating an administrative user.

desc.p: This template creates a user domain, types, and rules for the user's tty, pty, home directories, tmp, and tmpfs files.

The privileges given to administrative users are:
Raw disk access
Set all sysctls
All kernel ring buffer controls
Create, read, write, and delete all files but shadow
Manage source and binary format SELinux policy
Run insmod

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., sysadm is the prefix for sysadm_t).

interface.name: userdom_spec_domtrans_all_users
interface.summary: Execute a shell in all user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_xsession_spec_domtrans_all_users
interface.summary: Execute an Xserver session in all unprivileged user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_spec_domtrans_unpriv_users
interface.summary: Execute a shell in all unprivileged user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.summary: Execute an Xserver session in all unprivileged user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.summary: Manage unpriviledged user SysV sempaphores.

interface.name: userdom_bin_spec_domtrans_unpriv_users
interface.summary: Execute bin_t in the unprivileged user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_sbin_spec_domtrans_unpriv_users
interface.summary: Execute generic sbin programs in all unprivileged user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_entry_spec_domtrans_unpriv_users
interface.summary: Execute all entrypoint files in unprivileged user domains. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_shell_domtrans_sysadm
interface.summary: Execute a shell in the sysadm domain.

interface.name: userdom_bin_spec_domtrans_sysadm
interface.summary: Execute a generic bin program in the sysadm domain.

interface.name: userdom_sbin_spec_domtrans_sysadm
interface.summary: Execute a generic sbin program in the sysadm domain.

interface.name: userdom_entry_spec_domtrans_sysadm
interface.summary: Execute all entrypoint files in the sysadm domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

interface.name: userdom_sysadm_bin_spec_domtrans_to
interface.summary: Allow sysadm to execute a generic bin program in a specified domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

desc.p: Allow sysadm to execute a generic bin program in a specified domain.
This is a interface to support third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

interface.name: userdom_sysadm_sbin_spec_domtrans_to
interface.summary: Allow sysadm to execute a generic sbin program in a specified domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

desc.p: Allow sysadm to execute a generic sbin program in a specified domain.
This is a interface to support third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

interface.name: userdom_sysadm_entry_spec_domtrans_to
interface.summary: Allow sysadm to execute all entrypoint files in the specified domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

desc.p: Allow sysadm to execute all entrypoint files in the specified domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().
This is a interface to support third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

desc.p: This template creates types used for web pages and web cgi to be used from the user home directory.
This template is invoked automatically for each user, and generally does not need to be invoked directly by policy writers.

module.name: mta
module.summary: Policy common to all email tranfer agents.

interface.name: mta_stub
interface.summary: MTA stub interface. No access allowed.

template.name: mta_base_mail_template
template.summary: Basic mail transfer agent domain template.

desc.p: This template creates a derived domain which is a email transfer agent, which sends mail on behalf of the user.
This is the basic types and rules, common to the system agent and user agents.

param.name: domain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

template.name: mta_per_role_template
template.summary: The per role template for the mta module.

desc.p: This template creates a derived domain which is a email transfer agent, which sends mail on behalf of the user.
This template is invoked automatically for each user, and generally does not need to be invoked directly by policy writers.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

param.name: user_domain
param.summary: The type of the user domain.

param.name: user_role
param.summary: The role associated with the user domain.

template.summary: Provide extra permissions for admin users mail domain.

param.name: userdomain_prefix
param.summary: The prefix of the user domain (e.g., user is the prefix for user_t).

param.name: user_domain
param.summary: The type of the user domain.

interface.name: mta_mailserver
interface.summary: Make the specified domain usable for a mail server.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used as a mail server domain.

interface.name: mta_sendmail_mailserver
interface.summary: Modified mailserver interface for sendmail daemon use.

desc.p: A modified MTA mail server interface for the sendmail program. It's design does not fit well with policy, and using the regular interface causes a type_transition conflict if direct running of init scripts is enabled.
This interface should most likely only be used by the sendmail policy.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The type to be used for the mail server.

param.name: entry_point
param.summary: The type to be used for the domain entry point program.

interface.summary: Make a type a mailserver type used for sending mail on behalf of local users to the local mail spool.

param.name: domain
param.summary: Mail server domain type used for sending local mail.

interface.name: mta_send_mail
interface.summary: Send mail from the system.

interface.name: mta_sendmail_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute send mail in a specified domain.

desc.p: Execute send mail in a specified domain.
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.

This template is invoked automatically for each user, and generally does not need to be invoked directly by policy writers.

desc.p: This template creates a domains to be used for creating a ssh server. This is typically done to have multiple ssh servers of different sensitivities, such as for an internal network-facing ssh server, and a external network-facing ssh server.

Allow making the heap executable.
Allow making anonymous memory executable, e.g. for runtime-code generation or executable stack.
Allow making a modified private file mapping executable (text relocation).
Allow making the stack executable via mprotect. Also requires allow_execmem.
Allow ftp servers to modify public files used for public file transfer services.
Allow ftp servers to use cifs used for public file transfer services.
Allow ftp servers to use nfs used for public file transfer services.
Allow gssd to read temp directory.
Allow Apache to modify public files used for public file transfer services.
Allow Apache to use mod_auth_pam
Allow java executable stack
Allow system to run with kerberos
Allow nfs servers to modify public files used for public file transfer services.
Allow rsync to modify public files used for public file transfer services.
Allow sasl to read shadow
Allow samba to modify public files used for public file transfer services.
Allow system to run with NIS
Enable extra rules in the cron domain to support fcron.
Allow ftp to read and write files in the user home directories
Allow ftpd to run directly without inetd
Enable reading of urandom for all domains.
This should be enabled when all programs are compiled with ProPolice/SSP stack smashing protection. All domains will be allowed to read from /dev/urandom.
Allow httpd to use built in scripting (usually php)
Allow http daemon to tcp connect
Allow httpd to connect to mysql/posgresql
Allow httpd to act as a relay
Allow httpd cgi support
Allow httpd to act as a FTP server by listening on the ftp port.
Allow httpd to read home directories
Run SSI execs in system CGI script domain.
Allow http daemon to communicate with the TTY
Run CGI in the main httpd domain
Allow BIND to write the master zone files. Generally this is used for dynamic DNS.
Allow nfs to be exported read/write.
Allow nfs to be exported read only
Allow pppd to load kernel modules for certain modems
Allow reading of default_t files.
Allow samba to export user home directories.
Allow samba to export NFS volumes.
Allow squid to connect to all ports, not just HTTP, FTP, and Gopher ports.
Configure stunnel to be a standalone daemon or inetd service.
Support NFS home directories
Support SAMBA home directories
Control users use of ping and traceroute
Allow gpg executable stack
Allow mplayer executable stack
Allow sysadm to ptrace all processes
allow host key based authentication
Allow users to connect to mysql
Allows clients to write to the X server shared memory segments.
Allow cdrecord to read various content. nfs, samba, removable devices, user temp and untrusted content files
Allow system cron jobs to relabel filesystem for restoring file contexts.
force to games to run in user_t mapping executable (text relocation).
Disable transitions to evolution domains.
Disable transitions to user mozilla domains
Disable transitions to user thunderbird domains
Allow email client to various content. nfs, samba, removable devices, user temp and untrusted content files
Control mozilla content access
Allow pppd to be run for a regular user
Allow applications to read untrusted content If this is disallowed, Internet content has to be manually relabeled for read access to be granted
Allow ssh to run from inetd instead of as a daemon.
Allow user spamassassin clients to use the network.
Allow ssh logins as sysadm_r:sysadm_t
Allow staff_r users to search the sysadm home dir and read files (such as ~/.bashrc)
Allow regular users direct mouse access
Allow users to read system messages.
Allow users to control network interfaces (also needs USERCTL=true)
Allow user to r/w files on filesystems that do not have extended attributes (FAT, CDROM, FLOPPY)
Allow users to run TCP servers (bind to ports and accept connection from the same domain and outside users) disabling this forces FTP passive mode and may change other protocols.
Allow w to display everyone
Allow applications to write untrusted content If this is disallowed, no Internet content will be stored.
Allow xdm logins as sysadm
Allow all daemons the ability to use unallocated ttys
Allow mount to mount any file
Allow spammd to read/write user home directories.
Enabling secure mode disallows programs, such as newrole, from transitioning to administrative user domains.
Disable transitions to insmod.
boolean to determine whether the system permits loading policy, setting enforcing mode, and changing boolean values. Set this to true and you have to reboot to set it back
